{"step_by_step_thinking": "The thermic effect of food, also known as dietary induced thermogenesis, is the energy expended by our bodies in order to consume (bite, chew and swallow) and process (digest, absorb, transport, metabolize and store) food. Different macronutrients have different thermic effects. Protein has the highest thermic effect, meaning that more energy is used to process protein compared to fats and carbohydrates.", "answer_choice": "B. Protein"}
